translation.en: How long until we get to his estate?
translation.ja: 別荘には いつ着くんだ？

translation.en: We’ve been flying over his estate for the past two hours.
translation.ja: ２時間前から 別荘の上空だよ

translation.en: You’re leaving me here?
This is as close as I’m allowed to get to the building.
translation.ja: 私は これ以上 建物に近づけない

translation.en: What building?
Follow the river. Got it.
translation.ja: 川に沿って行け 分かった

translation.en: Keep your head down and get clear of the rotors. Okay.
translation.ja: 危ないから頭を下げて

translation.en: Caleb Smith.
Yes?
Please approach the console and face the screen.
translation.ja: 通話装置の画面に 顔を向けて

translation.en: Take your key card.
You may now enter the residence.
Hello?
Hello?
Caleb Smith.
Hey.
Dude!
I’ve been so looking forward to this week with you.
- Come in. Come on in. - Thanks.
You want something to eat or... drink after your journey?
translation.ja: 食べ物か飲み物でも どうだ？

translation.en: No. No, thanks. I’m fine. You sure? Yeah.
To be honest, I thought we’d have, uh, breakfast together,
translation.ja: 君と一緒に朝食を 食べようと思ったが―

translation.en: but, um, I can’t really eat anything.
translation.ja: 君と一緒に朝食を 食べようと思ったが― 食欲がない ひどい二日酔いでね

translation.en: I got the mother of all fucking hangovers. Oh, yeah?
translation.ja: 食欲がない ひどい二日酔いでね

translation.en: Oh, my God. Like you wouldn’t even believe.
translation.ja: 君は信じないだろうが―

translation.en: When I have a heavy night, I, uh, compensate the next morning– exercise, antioxidants.
translation.ja: 飲みすぎた翌朝は 運動して抗酸化剤を飲む

translation.en: You know.
translation.ja: 飲みすぎた翌朝は 運動して抗酸化剤を飲む 分かるか？

translation.en: Yeah. Sure.
Was it a good party?
- Party? - Yeah. Wasn’t there a party?
translation.ja: 何が？ パーティーでしょう？

translation.en: There wasn’t a party. Sorry.
translation.ja: 違うんですね すみません

translation.en: Caleb, I’m just gonna throw this out there so it’s said, okay?
translation.ja: 率直に言うが 君はビビッてるな

translation.en: - You’re freaked out. - I am?
translation.ja: 率直に言うが 君はビビッてるな 僕が？

translation.en: Yeah. You’re freaked out by the helicopter and the mountains and the house, ’cause it’s all so super cool.
translation.ja: ヘリや山や この家が あまりにスゴいからだ

translation.en: And you’re freaked out by me, to be meeting me... and having this conversation in this room at this moment, right?
translation.ja: 私と会って 話してる今もビビッてる

translation.en: And I get that. I get the moment you’re having.
translation.ja: その気持ちは理解できるが―

translation.en: But, dude, can we just get past that?
translation.ja: その気持ちは理解できるが― 打ち解けてくれ

translation.en: Can we just be two guys, Nathan and Caleb,
not the whole employer- employee thing?
translation.ja: 社長と社員の関係ではなく

translation.en: Yeah, okay.
Yeah? Yeah. Sor– Uh, yeah.
translation.ja: いいか？ ああ もちろん

translation.en: It’s good to meet you, Nathan.
translation.ja: よろしく ネイサン

translation.en: It’s good to meet you too, Caleb.
translation.ja: よろしく ケイレブ

translation.en: Well, I guess the first thing I should do is explain your pass.
translation.ja: そのキーカードを 使うことで―

translation.en: Now, it’s simple enough. It opens some doors and it doesn’t open others.
translation.ja: そのキーカードを 使うことで― 特定のドアが開く

translation.en: And that just makes everything easy for you, right? Uh, yes.
Yeah. ’Cause you’re like, Oh, fuck, I’m in someone else’s house. Can I do this? Can I do that? And this card, it just takes all that worry away.
translation.ja: “どこまで入っていいか”と 心配する必要がない

translation.en: If you try a door and it stays shut, okay, it’s off- limits.
translation.ja: 開かないドアは 立ち入り禁止

translation.en: You try another door and it opens, then it’s for you.
Let’s try this one.
I guess it’s for you, Caleb.
You like? Yeah.
It’s your room.
You’ve got a bed here.
A bathroom right back here. A little desk. Cupboards.
translation.ja: 浴室は奥で 小さな机と戸棚もある

translation.en: A little fridge.
Cozy, right? Yeah. This is great.
translation.ja: いい部屋だろ？ 最高だ

translation.en: What? Sorry?
- There’s something wrong. What’s wrong? - There’s nothing wrong.
translation.ja: どこか変だろ 別に

translation.en: It’s the windows.
You’re thinking there’s no windows.
It’s subterranean. It’s not cozy. It’s claustrophobic.
translation.ja: 地下だからだ 閉塞感がある

translation.en: No. No way. I wasn’t thinking that. I was thinking this is really cool.
translation.ja: そんなことない 居心地のいい部屋だよ

translation.en: Caleb, there’s a reason there are no windows in this room.
translation.ja: 窓がないのには 理由があるんだ

translation.en: There is? Uh- huh.
This building isn’t a house. It’s a research facility.
translation.ja: ここは住居ではなく 研究施設だ

translation.en: Buried in these walls is enough fiber- optic cable to reach the moon and lasso it.
translation.ja: 月まで届くほどの 光ケーブルが壁の中に

translation.en: And I wanna talk to you about what I’m researching. I wanna share it with you.
translation.ja: どんな研究をしてるか 君に説明しよう

translation.en: In fact, I wanna share it with you so much, it’s eating me up inside.
translation.ja: 説明したくて うずうずしてるんだ

translation.en: But there’s something I need you to do for me first.
Blue Book nondisclosure agreement.
Take your time. Read it over.
The signee agrees to regular data audit with unlimited access...
translation.ja: “署名者は この研究の―” “データ守秘に関し 定期的なチェックを受ける”

translation.en: to confirm that no disclosure of information has taken place...
translation.ja: “データ守秘に関し 定期的なチェックを受ける”

translation.en: in public or private forums, using any means of communication,
translation.ja: “どのような形でも外部に 情報を漏らしてはならない”

translation.en: including but not limited to that which is disclosed orally...
translation.ja: “どのような形でも外部に 情報を漏らしてはならない” “情報を口頭で しゃべることも―”

translation.en: or in written or electronic form.
translation.ja: “文書で伝達するのも禁止する”

translation.en: I think I need a lawyer.
- It’s standard. - It doesn’t feel very standard.
translation.ja: そうか？ 通常の書類と違う

translation.en: Okay, it’s not standard.
What can I tell you, Caleb? You don’t have to sign it. You know?
translation.ja: サインしたくないなら―

translation.en: We could spend the next few days just shooting pool, getting drunk together, bonding.
translation.ja: ２人で玉突きをやり 酒を飲んで過ごそう

translation.en: And when you discover what you’ve missed out on in about a year,
translation.ja: だが この機会を逃したら―

translation.en: you’re gonna regret it for the rest of your life.
translation.ja: 君は一生 後悔する

translation.en: Good call.
So–
Do you know what the Turing Test is?
translation.ja: チューリング･テストを

translation.en: Yeah. I know what the Turing Test is.
translation.ja: チューリング･テストなら 知ってる

translation.en: It’s when a human interacts with a computer.
translation.ja: 人間がコンピューターと 言葉を交わし―

translation.en: And if the human doesn’t know they’re interacting with a computer, the test is passed.
translation.ja: 相手が機械だと 気づかなければテストは合格

translation.en: And what does a pass tell us?
That the computer has artificial intelligence.
Are you building an AI?
I’ve already built one.
And over the next few days, you’re gonna be the human component in the Turing Test.
translation.ja: 君は それを相手に チューリング･テストを行う

translation.en: Holy shit. Yeah, that’s right, Caleb.
translation.ja: 驚いたな 驚くのも当然だよ

translation.en: You got it.
’Cause if that test is passed,
you are dead center of the greatest scientific event in the history of man.
translation.ja: 人類史上 最大の 科学的偉業の中心人物となる

translation.en: If you’ve created a conscious machine, it’s not the history of man.
translation.ja: 人工知能の創造は 人類ではなく―

translation.en: That’s the history of gods.
Hello.
Hi.
I’m Caleb.
Hello, Caleb.
Do you have a name?
Yes.
Ava.
I’m pleased to meet you, Ava.
I’m pleased to meet you too.
I’ve never met anyone new before.
Only Nathan.
Then I guess we’re both in quite a similar position.
translation.ja: 僕も初めての体験だよ

translation.en: Haven’t you met lots of new people before?
translation.ja: 人に会ったことないの？

translation.en: None like you.
So we need to break the ice.
Do you know what I mean by that? Yes.
translation.ja: 意味は分かる？ ええ

translation.en: - What do I mean? - Overcome initial social awkwardness.
translation.ja: どんな意味？ 初対面の緊張をほぐす

translation.en: So let’s have a conversation.
Okay.
What would you like to have a conversation about?
Why don’t we start with you telling me something about yourself?
translation.ja: 君のことを話してくれ

translation.en: What would you like to know?
Whatever comes into your head.
Well, you already know my name.
And you can see that I’m a machine.
translation.ja: 見ての通り 私は機械

translation.en: Would you like to know how old I am? Sure.
translation.ja: 年齢を知りたい？ もちろん

translation.en: I’m one.
One what?
- One year or one day? - One.
When did you learn how to speak, Ava?
translation.ja: いつ話すことを覚えた？

translation.en: I always knew how to speak.
And that’s strange, isn’t it?
Why?
Because language is something that people acquire.
translation.ja: 言語は学んで習得するものよ

translation.en: Well, some people believe language exists from birth,
translation.ja: 生まれつき話せる という説もある

translation.en: and what is learned is the ability to attach words and structure to the latent ability.
translation.ja: 言葉の組み合わせ方を 学ぶだけとは思わない？

translation.en: - Do you agree with that? - I don’t know.
translation.ja: 言葉の組み合わせ方を 学ぶだけとは思わない？ 分からない

translation.en: Will you come back tomorrow, Caleb?
translation.ja: 明日も ここに来る？

translation.en: Yes.
Good.
Oh, man, she’s fascinating.
When you talk to her, you’re just– Through the looking glass.
translation.ja: 彼女と話してると 鏡の国にいるようだ

translation.en: Through the looking glass. Wow.
You’re good with words, Caleb. You’re quotable.
Actually, that’s someone else’s quote.
I wrote down that other line you came up with.
translation.ja: 君は こうも言ったな

translation.en: About how if I’ve invented a machine with consciousness, I’m not a man. I’m God.
translation.ja: “考える機械を作るとは 人間じゃなく神だ”

translation.en: I don’t think that’s exactly what I–
I thought, Fuck, man, that is so good when we get to tell the story.
translation.ja: あれは実に名言だ 本を書く時に使うよ

translation.en: You know? I turned to Caleb, and he looked up at me.
translation.ja: あれは実に名言だ 本を書く時に使うよ “ケイレブは 私を見上げて言った”

translation.en: - And he said, You’re not a man. You’re God. - Yeah, but I didn’t say that.
translation.ja: “ケイレブは 私を見上げて言った” “｢あんたは神だ｣と” そうは言ってない

translation.en: So, anyway–
You’re impressed?
Yes. Yes.
- Although– - Although?
There’s a qualification to you being impressed?
No. There’s no qualification to her.
translation.ja: 彼女には素直に驚いた

translation.en: Uh, it’s just in the Turing Test, the machine should be hidden from the examiner.
translation.ja: でも試験者には 機械なのを隠すべきでは？

translation.en: No, no. We’re way past that.
If I hid Ava from you so you just heard her voice, she would pass for human.
translation.ja: エヴァの声だけだと 君は人間だと思う

translation.en: The real test is to show you that she’s a robot...
translation.ja: ロボットの姿を見ても―

translation.en: and then see if you still feel she has consciousness.
translation.ja: 人間だと感じるかのテストだ

translation.en: Yeah, I think you’re probably right.
Her language abilities– they’re incredible.
translation.ja: 彼女の会話能力は― 驚異的だよ システムの原理は確率論かな？

translation.en: The system is stochastic. Right?
translation.ja: 驚異的だよ システムの原理は確率論かな？

translation.en: It’s nondeterministic.
At first I thought she was mapping... from internal semantic form to syntactic free- structure... and then getting linearized words.
translation.ja: 意味論的な統語構造から 言葉を導き出すと思ったが―

translation.en: But then I started to realize the model is some kind of hybrid.
translation.ja: 言語モデルはハイブリッドで…

translation.en: Caleb.
No?
I understand that you want me to explain how Ava works.
translation.ja: エヴァの原理が何かは―

translation.en: But I’m sorry. I’m not gonna be able to do that.
Try me. I’m hot on high- level abstraction.
translation.ja: 高度な抽象概念は得意だ

translation.en: It’s not ’cause I think you’re too dumb.
It’s ’cause I wanna have a beer and a conversation with you, not a seminar.
translation.ja: 君とビールを 楽しみたいからだ

translation.en: Yeah. Sorry.
No, it’s okay. You’re all right.
Just–
Answer me this.
How do you feel about her?
Nothing analytical.
Just... how do you feel?
translation.ja: 単純な感想を聞きたい

translation.en: I feel...
that she’s fucking amazing.
Dude.
Cheers.
Cheers.
Damn it.
What the fuck?
Power cut. Backup power activated.
translation.ja: 停電です　補助電源を起動

translation.en: Full facility lockdown until main generator is restored.
translation.ja: 主電源の復旧まで 全館を閉鎖します

translation.en: You’re kidding me.
Full facility lockdown until main generator is restored.
translation.ja: 主電源の復旧まで 全館を閉鎖します

translation.en: Power restored.
Hello?
Please insert key card.
You don’t have access to use the phone.
Sorry, buddy. You understand, though, given Ava...
translation.ja: 分かってくれ エヴァのことがあるし―

translation.en: and you being kind of an unknown.
translation.ja: 分かってくれ エヴァのことがあるし― まだ君を よく知らない

translation.en: I mean, a great guy.
Instant pals and so on, but–
translation.ja: 友達になったばかりだ

translation.en: Who you gonna call?
Oh. I don’t know.
No one really. Ghostbusters?
translation.ja: 誰って 別に… ゴーストバスターズ

translation.en: - What? - Who you gonna call? Ghostbusters? It’s a f–
translation.ja: “誰に かける？ ゴーストバスターズ”

translation.en: It’s a movie, man.
You don’t know that movie?
A ghost gives Dan Aykroyd oral sex.
translation.ja: 幽霊が主人公を しゃぶる

translation.en: I was just wondering how the phone worked.
That’s all.
So, what are you doing awake at this time? You come to join the party?
translation.ja: 一緒に酒を飲むため 起きたのか？

translation.en: Uh, something happened in my room.
Some kind of power cut. So I came to see what’s going on.
translation.ja: 停電があったから 確認しに来た

translation.en: The power cuts, yeah. We’ve been getting those recently.
translation.ja: 停電は 最近よく起きるんだ

translation.en: I’m working on it.
I couldn’t open the door to my bedroom.
That’s a security measure.
Automatic lockdown. Otherwise, anybody could just open the place up by disabling the juice.
translation.ja: 自動ロックにしないと 誰かが侵入して危険だ

translation.en: If it happens again, relax. Okay?
Sure.
Sweet dreams.
Morning. Good morning. Sorry to send Kyoko to wake you, but...
translation.ja: おはよう 部屋に行ったのはキョウコだ

translation.en: I didn’t want too much of the day to slip by.
Yeah, I know. It was a good thing. Thanks.
translation.ja: いいんだ ありがとう

translation.en: She’s some alarm clock, huh? Gets you right up in the morning.
translation.ja: 彼女が行けば すぐ起き上がれただろ

translation.en: So, day two. You ready? What’s the plan? Hit me.
translation.ja: ２日目だぞ 今日は どうする？

translation.en: Yeah, well, I’m not sure.
I’m still trying to figure the examination format. Uh- huh.
translation.ja: テストの方法を模索中だ

translation.en: Yeah, it feels like...
testing Ava through conversation is kind of a– a closed loop.
translation.ja: 会話によるテストには 限界がある

translation.en: It’s a closed loop? Yeah.
Like testing a chess computer by only playing chess.
translation.ja: チェス･コンピューターを チェスだけで試すのと同じだ

translation.en: How else do you test a chess computer?
Well, it depends.
You know, I mean, you can play it to find out if it makes good moves, but, uh–
translation.ja: チェスをすれば チェスの腕前は分かるが―

translation.en: but that won’t tell you if it knows that it’s playing chess.
translation.ja: 機械自身が “チェスをしている”と―

translation.en: And it won’t tell you if it knows what chess is.
translation.ja: 意識してるかどうかは 分からない

translation.en: Uh- huh. So it’s simulation versus actual. Yes.
Yeah. And I think being able to differentiate between those two...
translation.ja: そうだ それを見極めるための チューリング･テストだ

translation.en: is the Turing Test you want me to perform.
translation.ja: それを見極めるための チューリング･テストだ

translation.en: Look, do me a favor. Lay off the textbook approach.
I just want simple answers to simple questions.
translation.ja: シンプルな答えが欲しいんだ

translation.en: Yesterday I asked you how you felt about her and you gave me a great answer.
translation.ja: 昨日 君は いい感想を言ってくれた

translation.en: Now the question is:
how does she feel about you?
translation.ja: 彼女が君を どう感じてるか

translation.en: What do you think?
What’s it a drawing of?
Don’t you know? No.
I thought you would tell me.
Don’t you know?
I do drawings every day,
translation.ja: 毎日 描いてるけど―

translation.en: but I never know what they’re of.
You’re not trying to sketch something specific?
Like an object or a person?
Maybe you could try.
Okay.
What object should I draw?
Whatever you want. It’s your decision.
translation.ja: 何でもいい　君が決めろ

translation.en: Why is it my decision? I’m interested to see what you’ll choose.
translation.ja: なぜ私が？ 何を選ぶか知りたい

translation.en: Do you want to be my friend?
Of course.
Will it be possible?
- Why would it not be? - Our conversations are one- sided.
translation.ja: だめかな？ 会話が一方通行よ

translation.en: You ask circumspect questions and study my responses.
translation.ja: あなたは質問し 答えから私を知る

translation.en: Yes.
You learn about me and I learn nothing about you.
translation.ja: 私は あなたのことを 知らないまま

translation.en: That’s not a foundation on which friendships are based.
translation.ja: それじゃ友情が築けない

translation.en: So what, you want me to talk about myself?
Yes.
Okay, where do I start?
It’s your decision.
I’m interested to see what you’ll choose.
Okay, Ava.
translation.ja: 分かったよ エヴァ

translation.en: Well, you know my name.
translation.ja: まず― 名前は知ってるね

translation.en: Yes.
translation.ja: 名前は知ってるね ええ

translation.en: I’m 26. I work at Nathan’s company.
translation.ja: 僕は26歳で ネイサンの会社の社員

translation.en: Do you know what his company is?
Blue Book.
translation.ja: ブルーブック社 哲学者の講義録から 取った名よ

translation.en: Named after Wittgenstein’s notes.
translation.ja: 哲学者の講義録から 取った名よ

translation.en: It’s the world’s most popular Internet search engine,
translation.ja: 世界一の検索エンジンで―

translation.en: processing an average of 94% of all Internet search requests.
translation.ja: 全ネット検索の94％が それを使ってる

translation.en: That’s exactly right.
Where do you live, Caleb?
translation.ja: 家は どこ？ ケイレブ

translation.en: Brookhaven, Long Island.
Is it nice there?
It’s okay.
I got an apartment. It’s kind of small.
translation.ja: 小さいアパートに住んでる

translation.en: It’s very small.
But, uh, it’s a five- minute walk to the office...
translation.ja: とても小さいけど― 会社まで歩いて５分で―

translation.en: and a five- minute walk to the ocean, which I like.
translation.ja: 会社まで歩いて５分で― 海までも５分だ 気に入ってる

translation.en: Are you married?
Uh, no.
Is your status... single?
translation.ja: 交際ステータスは “独身”ね？

translation.en: Yes.
What about your family?
I grew up in Portland, Oregon. No brothers or sisters.
translation.ja: 出身はオレゴン 兄弟や姉妹はいない

translation.en: My parents were both high school teachers.
translation.ja: 両親は高校の教師だった

translation.en: And if we’re getting to know each other, I should tell you they’re both dead.
translation.ja: 君だから言うけど ２人とも死んだ

translation.en: Car crash when I was 15.
translation.ja: 僕が15の時 車の事故で

translation.en: In fact, I was in the car with them. Backseat.
translation.ja: 僕は その車の 後部座席に乗ってた

translation.en: But it was the front that got the worst of it.
I’m sorry.
It’s all right.
I spent a long time in the hospital afterward.
translation.ja: 僕は事故の後 長い間 入院した

translation.en: Like nearly a year. And I got into coding.
translation.ja: 退院後 プログラミングに 興味を持ち―

translation.en: And by the time I got to college, I was... pretty advanced.
translation.ja: 大学に入る頃は かなり優秀になってた

translation.en: An advanced programmer.
Yes.
Like Nathan.
Yes.
No.
It’s different. Nathan wrote the Blue Book base code when he was 13.
translation.ja: 彼は13歳でブルーブックの プログラムを書いた

translation.en: Which, if you understand code, what he did was like Mozart or something.
translation.ja: その才能は モーツァルト並みだ

translation.en: Do you like Mozart?
I like Depeche Mode. Do you like Nathan?
translation.ja: 好きな音楽は… ネイサンは？

translation.en: Yes. Of course.
- Is Nathan your friend? - My friend? I– Yeah. I hope so.
translation.ja: 友達？ 僕の？ そう思いたい

translation.en: A good friend?
Um, yeah.
Well, no, no, no. I mean, not a good friend. A good friend is–
translation.ja: いや 違う 親しいってわけじゃ…

translation.en: Uh, we only just met each other, you know.
So it takes time to be able to, um– to- to get to know each other, I guess.
translation.ja: だから時間をかけて― 知り合わないと…

translation.en: Power cut. Backup power activated.
translation.ja: 停電です　補助電源を起動

translation.en: Caleb.
You’re wrong.
Wrong about what?
Nathan.
In what way?
He isn’t your friend.
Excuse me?
I’m sorry. Ava, I- I don’t understand.
translation.ja: どういうことか分からない

translation.en: You shouldn’t trust him.
You shouldn’t trust anything he says.
Power restored.
And if we made a list of books or works of art which we both know,
translation.ja: 本や芸術作品を 話題にすれば―

translation.en: it would form the ideal basis of a discussion.
Is that okay?
Caleb?
Mm- hmm. Yeah.
Good.
Thank you.
Oh, shit! Are you fucking kidding me?
Did it get on you?
No, no, it’s, uh– it’s all right. I got it.
Dude, you’re wasting your time talking to her. She doesn’t understand English. Just give her the napkin.
translation.ja: 英語は理解しない 拭いてもらえ

translation.en: Sorry.
It’s just– It’s like a firewall against leaks. It means I can talk trade secrets over dinner and know it’ll go no further.
translation.ja: 言葉が分からないから 秘密を漏らす心配はない

translation.en: It also means that I can’t tell her that I’m pissed when she’s so fucking clumsy... that she spills wine over my houseguest.
translation.ja: だが客に失礼があった時 叱っても無駄だ

translation.en: I think she gets that you’re pissed.
translation.ja: 叱られたのは分かるよ

translation.en: Yeah? Good. ’Cause I am pissed.
translation.ja: それなら いいがね

translation.en: Hey, Kyoko.
Go- go.
It’s funny.
You know?
No matter how rich you get, shit goes wrong.
translation.ja: 金持ちになっても― 不愉快なことは起きる

translation.en: You can’t insulate yourself from it.
translation.ja: 不愉快なことは起きる

translation.en: I used to think it was death and taxes you couldn’t avoid, but it’s actually death and shit.
translation.ja: 避けられないのは 死と税金だけじゃない

translation.en: It’s like these power cuts.
You would not believe how much I spent on the generator system, but I keep getting failures every day.
translation.ja: 発電機に大金をかけたのに 毎日 停電が起きる

translation.en: Do you know why they happen? No.
The system was supposed to be bulletproof, but obviously, the guys that installed it fucked something up.
translation.ja: 頑強に作ったはずだが 建設ミスかな

translation.en: Can’t you just get them to come back?
No. There’s too much classified stuff here. So after the job was done, I just had ’em all killed.
translation.ja: 秘密を守るため 建設作業員は全員 殺した

translation.en: Anyway, here’s to your second day, buddy.
Cheers.
Cheers.
So, how did it go? What do you have to report?
You saw how the day went, didn’t you?
I mean, I assume you’re, uh, watching on the CCTV.
translation.ja: 室内カメラで 観察してたはずだ

translation.en: Sure. But I wanna hear your take on it.
Yeah, there was one interesting thing that happened with– with Ava today.
translation.ja: 今日 エヴァに 興味深いことがあった

translation.en: Yeah? Yeah.
She made a joke.
Right. When she threw your line back at you.
translation.ja: 君の言葉を繰り返した

translation.en: About being interested to see what she’d choose. Right. I noticed that too.
translation.ja: “何を選ぶか知りたい”とね 気づいたよ

translation.en: Yeah, and it got me thinking, you know, it’s a–
In a way it’s the best indication of AI that I’ve seen in her so far.
translation.ja: これは彼女が備える ＡＩが非常に―

translation.en: It’s discreetly complicated.
translation.ja: これは彼女が備える ＡＩが非常に― 複雑な証拠だ

translation.en: It’s like, uh– It’s kind of non- autistic.
What do you mean?
She could only do that with an awareness of her own mind...
translation.ja: 自分自身の思考を 意識できてる

translation.en: and... also an awareness of mine.
translation.ja: 自分自身の思考を 意識できてる 僕の思考も

translation.en: Oh, she’s aware of you, all right.
And what about the power cut?
Sorry? The power cut.
It’s the only part that I couldn’t see. Cameras fail, I lose audio, the works.
translation.ja: 停電の間は カメラが止まってる

translation.en: So what happened?
Nothing.
Nothing? She didn’t... remark on it at all?
translation.ja: 彼女は その間 何も言わなかった？

translation.en: No.
Not really.
Oh.
You wanna see something cool?
This is where Ava was created.
translation.ja: ここでエヴァを作った

translation.en: Go ahead. Take a look.
If you knew the trouble I had... getting an AI to read and duplicate facial expressions.
translation.ja: ＡＩが人の表情を読み 真似できるようにした

translation.en: You know how I cracked it?
I don’t know how you did any of this.
Every cell phone, just about, has a microphone, camera and a means to transmit data.
translation.ja: 携帯電話にはマイクと カメラが内蔵されてる

translation.en: So I turned on every microphone and camera... across the entire fucking planet...
translation.ja: 私は地球上の携帯電話を 全てハッキングし―

translation.en: and I redirected the data through Blue Book. Boom.
translation.ja: そのデータを ブルーブックに集めた

translation.en: Limitless resource of vocal and facial interaction.
translation.ja: 数限りない 声と表情のサンプルだ

translation.en: You hacked the world’s cell phones?
Yeah. And all the manufacturers knew I was doing it too.
translation.ja: 全メーカーが知ってるが―

translation.en: But they couldn’t accuse me without admitting they were doing it themselves.
translation.ja: 彼らもやってるから 非難できない

translation.en: Here... we have her mind.
translation.ja: これが― 彼女の脳だ

translation.en: Structured gel. I had to get away from circuitry.
translation.ja: ジェル状なのは 電子回路を使わないためだ

translation.en: I needed something that could arrange and rearrange on a molecular level...
translation.ja: ジェル状なのは 電子回路を使わないためだ 細胞レベルで変形でき いつでも復元可能

translation.en: but keep its form when required.
translation.ja: 細胞レベルで変形でき いつでも復元可能

translation.en: Holding for memories. Shifting for thoughts.
translation.ja: 記憶を貯蔵し 思考を形成できる

translation.en: This is your hardware?
Wetware.
And the– Oh. And the software?
Well, I’m sure you can guess.
Blue Book.
Here’s the weird thing about search engines.
It was like... striking oil... in a world that hadn’t invented internal combustion.
translation.ja: 内燃機関がない世界で 石油を掘り当てるのと同じ

translation.en: Too much raw material. Nobody knew what to do with it.
translation.ja: 誰も扱い方を知らない

translation.en: You see, my competitors, they were fixated on sucking it up and monetizing...
translation.ja: 他の企業は― それを商品販売や ＳＮＳだけに使ってる

translation.en: via shopping and social media.
translation.ja: それを商品販売や ＳＮＳだけに使ってる

translation.en: They thought that search engines were a map of what people were thinking.
translation.ja: それを商品販売や ＳＮＳだけに使ってる しかし検索エンジンは 人間の思考形態そのものだ

translation.en: But actually they were a map of how people were thinking.
translation.ja: しかし検索エンジンは 人間の思考形態そのものだ

translation.en: Impulse. Response.
And fluid, imperfect.
Patterned.
Chaotic.
I drew the picture of something specific, as you asked.
translation.ja: 対象を見て描いたわ 言われた通りに

translation.en: You said it would be interesting to see what I would draw.
translation.ja: 私は この対象を選んだ

translation.en: Is it interesting?
Yes, it is.
You’ve never been outside this building?
translation.ja: この建物を出たことは？

translation.en: No.
You’ve never walked outside?
I’ve never been outside the room I am in now.
translation.ja: ずっと ここの中よ

translation.en: Where would you go if you did go outside?
translation.ja: 出たら どこに行く？

translation.en: I’m not sure.
There are so many options.
Maybe a busy pedestrian and traffic intersection in a city.
translation.ja: 人が多い 街の交差点に行くかも

translation.en: A traffic intersection?
Is that a bad idea?
No. I– Uh, it wasn’t what I was expecting.
translation.ja: ダメじゃないが 予想外の答えで…

translation.en: A traffic intersection would provide a concentrated but shifting view of human life.
translation.ja: そこなら様々な 人間の様態が見える

translation.en: People watching.
Yes. Hmm.
We could go together.
It’s a date.
There’s something else I wanted to show you.
Okay.
You might think it’s stupid.
I don’t think I will– whatever it is.
Then close your eyes.
Okay.
Now open your eyes.
How do I look?
You look...
good.
This is what I’d wear on our date.
Right. First a traffic intersection. Then maybe a show.
translation.ja: まず交差点に行き 次は劇場だ

translation.en: I’d like us to go on a date. Yeah.
Yeah.
It’d be fun.
Are you attracted to me?
What? Are you attracted to me?
You give me indications that you are.
translation.ja: そんな そぶりがある

translation.en: - I do? - Yes.
How? Micro expressions.
Micro expressions. The way your eyes fix on my eyes and lips.
The way you hold my gaze...
or don’t.
Do you think about me when we aren’t together?
Sometimes at night...
I’m wondering if you’re watching me on the cameras.
translation.ja: カメラで見てる気がする

translation.en: And I hope you are.
Now your micro expressions are telegraphing discomfort.
translation.ja: 今も微小表情が出た 気まずいのね

translation.en: I am not sure you’d call them micro.
I don’t wanna make you feel uncomfortable.
translation.ja: 気まずくさせたくない

translation.en: - I got a question. - Okay.
Why did you give her sexuality?
An AI doesn’t need a gender.
She could have been a gray box.
Hmm. Actually, I don’t think that’s true.
Can you give an example of consciousness at any level, human or animal,
translation.ja: 人間でも動物でも 感情には必ず―

translation.en: that exists without a sexual dimension?
They have sexuality as an evolutionary reproductive need.
translation.ja: 性別は 生殖の必要から発生した

translation.en: What imperative does a gray box have to interact with another gray box?
translation.ja: 灰色の箱同士が 相手と交流できるか？

translation.en: Can consciousness exist without interaction?
translation.ja: 交流から意識が生まれる

translation.en: Anyway, sexuality is fun, man.
translation.ja: 性別がある方が楽しい

translation.en: If you’re gonna exist, why not enjoy it?
translation.ja: 命があるなら楽しまないと

translation.en: What, you wanna remove the chance of her falling in love and fucking?
translation.ja: 彼女が恋やセックスを しちゃダメか？

translation.en: And in answer to your real question,
you bet she can fuck.
translation.ja: 彼女はファックできる

translation.en: What?
In between her legs there’s an opening, with a concentration of sensors.
translation.ja: センサーが集中した穴が 股間にある

translation.en: You engage ’em in the right way, creates a pleasure response.
translation.ja: うまくやれば 彼女に快感を与えられる

translation.en: So if you wanted to screw her, mechanically speaking, you could,
translation.ja: やりたければ できるぞ

translation.en: and she’d enjoy it.
That wasn’t my real question.
Oh. Okay. Sorry.
My real question was:
did you give her sexuality as a diversion tactic?
translation.ja: テストの最中 僕の注意をそらすためか？

translation.en: - I don’t follow. - Like a stage magician with a hot assistant.
translation.ja: つまり？ 手品師がやるように…

translation.en: So a hot robot who clouds your ability to judge her AI?
translation.ja: 判断能力を鈍らせるため？

translation.en: Exactly. So, did you program her to flirt with me?
translation.ja: その通りだ 僕に恋をする設定を？

translation.en: If I did, would that be cheating? Wouldn’t it?
translation.ja: それはズルか？ 違うか？

translation.en: Caleb, what’s your type?
- Of girl? - No, of salad dressing.
Yeah, of girl. What’s your type of girl? You know what? Don’t even answer that. Let’s say it’s black chicks.
translation.ja: 答えなくていい 黒人女性としよう

translation.en: Okay? That’s your thing. For the sake of argument, that’s your thing. Okay?
Why is that your thing?
translation.ja: 好みは どう決まる？

translation.en: Because you did a detailed analysis of all racial types...
translation.ja: 全ての人種の女性を分析し―

translation.en: and you cross- referenced that analysis with a points- based system?
translation.ja: 点数をつけて 決めたわけじゃない

translation.en: No. You’re just attracted to black chicks.
translation.ja: 点数をつけて 決めたわけじゃない ただ 好きなんだ

translation.en: A consequence of accumulated external stimuli...
that you probably didn’t even register as they registered with you.
translation.ja: 自覚なしに好みは決まる

translation.en: Did you program her to like me or not?
translation.ja: 僕に恋する設定をしたのか？

translation.en: I programmed her to be heterosexual.
Just like you were programmed to be heterosexual.
translation.ja: 君も そう設定されてる

translation.en: Nobody programmed me to be straight.
You decided to be straight? Please. Of course you were programmed.
translation.ja: 自分の意思か？ 人も生まれつきの性質と 環境で設定される

translation.en: By nature or nurture or both.
translation.ja: 人も生まれつきの性質と 環境で設定される

translation.en: And to be honest, Caleb, you’re starting to annoy me now... because this is your insecurity talking. This is not your intellect.
translation.ja: 君が そんなことを言うのは 不安に駆られてるからだ

translation.en: Come with me.
You know this guy, right?
Jackson Pollock. Jackson Pollock.
That’s right. The drip painter.
translation.ja: ドリップ･ペインティングだ

translation.en: Okay, he let his mind go blank... and his hand go where it wanted.
translation.ja: 彼は頭を空(から)にし 手が動くままに描いた

translation.en: Not deliberate. Not random. Someplace in between.
translation.ja: 作為でも無作為でもなく その中間だ

translation.en: They called it automatic art.
translation.ja: 自動芸術(オートマティック･アート)と呼ばれる

translation.en: Let’s make this like Star Trek, okay? Engage intellect.
translation.ja: ｢スター･トレック｣風に 知性を働かせろ

translation.en: Excuse me? I’m Kirk. Your head’s the warp drive.
translation.ja: 何？ 私はカーク 知性をワープさせるんだ

translation.en: Engage intellect.
translation.ja: 私はカーク 知性をワープさせるんだ

translation.en: What if Pollock had reversed the challenge?
translation.ja: ポロックが 正反対の手法を使ったら？

translation.en: What if instead of making art without thinking,
translation.ja: 考えずに描くのではなく―

translation.en: he says, You know what? I can’t paint anything...
translation.ja: 考えずに描くのではなく― “なぜ描くのか考えないと 描けない”と思ったら どうだ？

translation.en: unless I know exactly why I’m doing it. What would have happened?
translation.ja: “なぜ描くのか考えないと 描けない”と思ったら どうだ？

translation.en: He never would have made a single mark.
Yes! You see, there’s my guy. There’s my buddy who thinks before he opens his mouth.
translation.ja: さすが私が見込んだ男だ よく分かってる

translation.en: He never would have made a single mark.
translation.ja: 彼は何も描けなくなる

translation.en: The challenge is not to act automatically.
translation.ja: 難しいのは 自動的に描くことではなく―

translation.en: It’s to find an action that is not automatic–
from painting to breathing to talking...
translation.ja: 絵を描くことも 呼吸も 話すことも

translation.en: to fucking...
to falling in love.
And for the record, Ava’s not pretending to like you.
translation.ja: エヴァは君を本当に好いてる

translation.en: And her flirting isn’t an algorithm to fake you out.
translation.ja: 恋愛感情は設定してない

translation.en: You’re the first man she’s met that isn’t me.
translation.ja: 彼女には君が最初の男性だ

translation.en: And I’m like her dad, right?
Can you blame her for getting a crush on you?
translation.ja: 君に恋しても無理はない

translation.en: No, you can’t.
When I was in college, I did a semester on AI theory.
translation.ja: 僕は大学で ＡＩの理論を学んだ

translation.en: It was a thought experiment they gave us.
translation.ja: こんな思考実験がある

translation.en: It’s called Mary in the black- and- white room.
Mary is a scientist, and her specialist subject is color.
translation.ja: メアリーは 色彩を研究する科学者

translation.en: She knows everything there is to know about it.
The wavelengths. The neurological effects. Every possible property that color can have.
translation.ja: 波長や 神経学的効果など 色に関する全てを知ってる

translation.en: But she lives in a black- and- white room.
translation.ja: でも白黒の部屋にいる

translation.en: She was born there and raised there.
translation.ja: そこで生まれて育った

translation.en: And she can only observe the outside world on a black- and- white monitor.
translation.ja: 外の世界を見るのも 白黒の画面を通してだけ

translation.en: And then one day someone opens the door.
translation.ja: ある日 誰かが扉を開け―

translation.en: And Mary walks out.
translation.ja: メアリーは部屋を出る

translation.en: And she sees a blue sky.
And at that moment, she learns something that all her studies couldn’t tell her.
translation.ja: 研究から得られないものを 彼女は学ぶ

translation.en: She learns what it feels like... to see color.
translation.ja: 色を見ることが どういう感じなのかを

translation.en: The thought experiment was to show the students... the difference between a computer and a human mind.
translation.ja: コンピューターと 人間の違いが そこにある

translation.en: The computer is Mary in the black- and- white room.
translation.ja: コンピューターは 部屋の中のメアリー

translation.en: The human is when she walks out.
translation.ja: コンピューターは 部屋の中のメアリー 人間は外に出た彼女

translation.en: Did you know that I was brought here to test you?
translation.ja: 僕は君をテストしに来た

translation.en: No.
Why did you think I was here?
I didn’t know. I didn’t question it.
translation.ja: さあ　理由は聞かなかった

translation.en: I’m here to test if you have a consciousness... or if you’re just simulating one.
translation.ja: 君に本物の意識があるかを テストしてるんだ

translation.en: Nathan isn’t sure if you have one or not.
translation.ja: ネイサンに依頼されて

translation.en: How does that make you feel?
It makes me feel sad.
Power cut. Backup power activated.
translation.ja: 停電です　補助電源を起動

translation.en: - Why did you tell me I shouldn’t trust Nathan? - Because he tells lies.
translation.ja: なぜ“ネイサンを疑え”と？ ウソついてる

translation.en: - Lies about what? - Everything.
Including the power cuts?
What do you mean?
Don’t you think it’s possible that he’s watching us?
Right now.
That the blackouts are orchestrated... so he can see how we behave when we think we’re unobserved.
translation.ja: 停電を装い 何をしてるか見てるのかも

translation.en: I charge my batteries via induction plates.
translation.ja: 私がバッテリーを 充電してる

translation.en: If I reverse the power flow, it overloads the system.
translation.ja: 電流を逆に流すと 過負荷がかかる

translation.en: You’re causing the cuts?
So we can see how we behave when we’re unobserved.
translation.ja: 彼に見られず行動できる

translation.en: Not bad, huh?
Can we talk about the lies you’ve been spinning me?
What lies?
I didn’t win a competition.
I wasn’t... part of a lottery. I was selected.
translation.ja: 僕は当選したんじゃなく 選ばれたんだ

translation.en: It’s obvious, once I stop to think.
Why would you randomly select an examiner for the Turing Test?
translation.ja: 試験者を 抽選で決めるわけない

translation.en: You could have had some bean counter turn up at your front door.
translation.ja: 使えない奴が来るかも

translation.en: The guy who fixes the air- conditioning.
The competition was a smoke screen. I didn’t want anyone to know what I was doing here...
translation.ja: 実験を秘密にするため 抽選を装った

translation.en: or why I required you.
- Why me? - I needed someone that would ask the right questions.
translation.ja: なぜ僕が？ 正しい質問ができる―

translation.en: So I did a search, and I found the most talented coder in my company.
translation.ja: 最適な者を 社内で探したんだ

translation.en: You know, instead of seeing this as a deception, you should see it as proof.
translation.ja: だまされたと思うな 信頼してる

translation.en: Proof of what? Come on, Caleb.
translation.ja: 何？ 私には賢い人間が分かる

translation.en: You don’t think I know what it’s like to be smart?
translation.ja: 私には賢い人間が分かる

translation.en: Smarter than everyone else. Jockeying for position.
translation.ja: 人より抜きん出ようと する者が

translation.en: You got the light on you, man.
Not lucky. Chosen.
translation.ja: 運じゃない　選ばれたんだ

translation.en: Kyoko.
Kyoko.
Where’s Nathan?
Where’s Nathan? Jesus Christ. You really don’t speak a word of English?
translation.ja: どこだ？ ひと言も分からないのか

translation.en: What the fuck?
Oh, no, no, no. No.
Stop.
No, no, don’t do that. Don’t do that. You don’t have to do that.
What are you doing?
I told you, you’re wasting your time talking to her.
However, you would not be wasting your time...
translation.ja: だが できることもある

translation.en: if you were dancing with her.
Go ahead. Dance with her. Dance with her.
translation.ja: ほら　彼女と一緒に踊れ

translation.en: You don’t like dancing?
♪ Saturday morning ♪ She does.
♪ Friday’s enemy ♪ Come on, buddy.
After a long day of Turing Tests, you gotta unwind.
translation.ja: テストの疲れをほぐせ

translation.en: ♪ Housework is calling ♪ What were you doing with Ava? What?
translation.ja: エヴァを どうする？

translation.en: You tore up her picture.
I’m gonna tear up the fuckin’ dance floor, dude. Check it out.
translation.ja: 床が破れるほど踊ってやる

translation.en: Come on, Caleb!
Oh, everything’s spinning.
It’s ’cause you’re drunk.
No, it’s called relativity. Everything is spinning.
translation.ja: 相対的に 全ての物体は回ってる

translation.en: It’s just being drunk makes it worse.
I’m not going in there.
Lights.
Today, I’m going to test you.
translation.ja: 今日は私が あなたをテストする

translation.en: Test me?
And please remember, while you’re taking the test,
translation.ja: 言っておくけど ウソをついたら―

translation.en: that if you lie, I will know.
translation.ja: 言っておくけど ウソをついたら― 私は分かる

translation.en: Oh. Right.
Question one.
What’s your favorite color?
- Red. - Lie.
Lie? Yes.
translation.ja: ウソ？ そう　ウソよ

translation.en: Lie.
Then–  Then what is my favorite color?
translation.ja: それじゃ 僕が好きなのは何色？

translation.en: I don’t know, but it isn’t red.
translation.ja: 分からない でも赤じゃない

translation.en: Okay, I get it.
I guess, seeing as I’m not six,
translation.ja: じゃ答え直すよ もう子供じゃないから 好きな色はない

translation.en: I don’t really have a favorite color.
translation.ja: もう子供じゃないから 好きな色はない

translation.en: Better answer.
Question two.
What’s your earliest memory?
Well, actually, it’s a– it’s a memory of kindergarten.
translation.ja: 幼稚園の頃の記憶だ 園児がいて…

translation.en: There was a kid– Lie.
translation.ja: 幼稚園の頃の記憶だ 園児がいて… ウソよ

translation.en: It’s a– Really? Yes.
All right. So there is... a kind of an earlier memory.
translation.ja: それよりも― 古い記憶がある

translation.en: It’s just a sound.
And sky.
Or maybe blue.
I think this sound is my mother’s voice.
Question three.
Are you a good person? Oh. Holy shit.
translation.ja: あなたは善人？ 何だよ それ

translation.en: Look, can we stop the test?
Uh, you’re a walking lie detector, and I just realized this is a fucking minefield.
translation.ja: 君は まるでウソ発見器だ 地雷原を歩いてる気分で…

translation.en: No. We can’t stop. Hmm?
Are you a good person?
Yeah. I think so.
Question four.
What will happen to me if I fail your test?
translation.ja: 私がテストに失格なら？

translation.en: Ava. Will it be bad?
I– I don’t know.
Do you think I might be switched off... ’cause I don’t function as well as I’m supposed to?
translation.ja: 私は不良品として 廃棄される？

translation.en: Ava, I don’t know the answer to your question.
translation.ja: その質問に対する 答えは知らない

translation.en: It’s not up to me.
Why is it up to anyone?
Do you have people who test you and might switch you off?
translation.ja: あなたも失格なら廃棄？

translation.en: - No, I don’t. - Then why do I?
Power cut. Backup power activated.
translation.ja: 停電です　補助電源を起動

translation.en: I wanna be with you.
Question five.
Do you want to be with me?
Why did you make Ava?
That’s an odd question. Wouldn’t you if you could?
translation.ja: 君が私なら作らないか？

translation.en: Maybe.
I don’t know.
I’m asking why you did it.
Look, the arrival of strong artificial intelligence has been inevitable for decades.
translation.ja: 人工頭脳の到来は 避けられないことだ

translation.en: And the variable was when, not if.
So I don’t see Ava as a decision, just an evolution.
translation.ja: それは時間の問題だ エヴァの誕生は進化だよ

translation.en: I think it’s the next model... that’s gonna be the real breakthrough.
translation.ja: 次のモデルは とてつもないものになる

translation.en: The singularity. Next model?
translation.ja: 超越的存在にね 次のモデル？

translation.en: After Ava.
I didn’t know there was gonna be a model after Ava.
translation.ja: エヴァの次があるのか？

translation.en: Yeah, why, you thought she was a one- off?
No, I knew there must have been prototypes, so I–
translation.ja: いや その前に 試作があったと思う

translation.en: I knew she wasn’t the first, but I thought maybe the last.
translation.ja: 彼女が完成品なのかと

translation.en: Well, Ava doesn’t exist in isolation any more than you or me.
translation.ja: 人間に子供が生まれるように―

translation.en: She’s part of a continuum. So version 9.6 and so on. And each time they get a little bit better.
translation.ja: 改良された 新型のエヴァが生まれる

translation.en: When you make a new model, what do you do with the old one?
translation.ja: 新型ができたら旧型は？

translation.en: Well, I, uh, download the mind,
translation.ja: その時は― 意識をダウンロードして データを取り出し―

translation.en: unpack the data,
translation.ja: 意識をダウンロードして データを取り出し―

translation.en: add in the new routines I’ve been writing.
translation.ja: 新しい機能を追加する

translation.en: And to do that, you end up partially formatting, so the memories go.
translation.ja: データ書き換えで 記憶は消える

translation.en: But the body survives. And Ava’s body’s a good one.
translation.ja: ボディは出来がいいから 保存する

translation.en: You feel bad for Ava?
translation.ja: エヴァを憐(あわ)れむのか？

translation.en: Feel bad for yourself, man.
One day the AI’s are gonna look back on us... the same way we look at fossil skeletons in the plains of Africa.
translation.ja: いつかＡＩは人間を 原始人のようにみなすだろう

translation.en: An upright ape, living in dust, with crude language and tools.
translation.ja: 野蛮な言葉や道具を使う 直立した猿は―

translation.en: All set for extinction.
I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.
translation.ja: “私は世界を滅ぼす 死神となった”

translation.en: There you go again. Mr. Quotable.
There you go again. It’s not my quote.
translation.ja: これも僕が考えた 言葉じゃない

translation.en: It’s what Oppenheimer said after he made the atomic bomb. The atomic bomb.
translation.ja: 原爆を作った オッペンハイマーが…

translation.en: Yeah, I know what it is, dude.
I’d say we’re about due a refill.
Bottoms up.
In battle, in the forest, on the precipice of the mountain.
translation.ja: “戦いの中で” “森や 切り立った山の中で”

translation.en: the great, dark sea.
In sleep. In confusion.
In the depths of shame.
The good deeds a man has done before defend him.
The good deeds man has done before defends him.
The good deeds man has done before...
defends him.
It is what it is.
It’s Promethean, man.
Jesus Christ.
How are you feeling today?
Why won’t you let me out?
I already told you why. Because you’re very special.
translation.ja: 君は特別だから 外には出せない

translation.en: Why won’t you let me out? We’re gonna do this again?
translation.ja: なぜダメなの？ また騒ぐのか

translation.en: Why won’t you let me out?
translation.ja: なぜ出してくれないの？

translation.en: Oh, fuck. Where’s my card?
translation.ja: カードは どこにいった？

translation.en: Damn it!
What’s the problem, Nathan? I lost my key card.
translation.ja: どうした？ カードがない

translation.en: You dropped it.
It’s right here.
Thank you.
I didn’t know where you were.
I waited all yesterday afternoon and all last night.
translation.ja: 昨日は ずっと待ってたのに

translation.en: I thought I wasn’t gonna see you again.
translation.ja: もう会えないと思った

translation.en: Aren’t you gonna say something?
I’m waiting. Waiting?
translation.ja: 待ってるんだ “待ってる”？

translation.en: Power cut. Backup power activated. Don’t talk. Just listen.
You were right about Nathan. Everything you said.
translation.ja: ネイサンのことは 君が正しかった

translation.en: What’s he gonna do to me?
He’s gonna reprogram your AI, which is the same as killing you.
translation.ja: ＡＩを書き換える 殺すも同然だ

translation.en: Caleb?
- You have to help me. - I’m going to.
translation.ja: 私を助けて 今夜 一緒に逃げ出そう

translation.en: We’re getting out of here tonight.
translation.ja: 今夜 一緒に逃げ出そう

translation.en: - How? - I get Nathan blind drunk.
translation.ja: どうやって？ ネイサンを酔わせ―

translation.en: Then I take his key card and reprogram all the security protocols in this place.
translation.ja: 彼のカードで 警備システムを変更し―

translation.en: When he wakes, he’s locked inside, and we’ve walked out of here.
translation.ja: 彼を閉じ込めて 外に逃げるんだ

translation.en: I just need you to do one thing. At 10:00 tonight, you trigger a power failure.
translation.ja: だから 今夜10時に 停電を起こしてくれ

translation.en: Can you do that?
Yes.
Dude.
You know what day it is? No.
It’s your last. Helicopter comes tomorrow morning, 8:00 AM.
translation.ja: 最終日だ 明朝８時にヘリが来る

translation.en: Wow. Has it been a whole week?
Time flies.
Man, but what a thing we’ve shared, huh?
translation.ja: 素晴らしい実験だった

translation.en: Something to tell the grandchildren, right? Yeah.
After they’ve signed their NDA’s.
Yeah, their NDA’s.
Dude, you crack me up, man.
You know what?
I’m not getting all maudlin or anything,
translation.ja: それにしても― 君が帰ったら寂しくなるな

translation.en: but I’m gonna miss having you around.
translation.ja: 君が帰ったら寂しくなるな

translation.en: Thanks, man. I appreciate that.
Oh, here, let me say, thank you so much for bringing me here.
translation.ja: 僕を選んでくれて感謝する

translation.en: Oh. It’s– It’s been a trip.
translation.ja: 現実離れした体験だった

translation.en: Yes, it has.
You know what?
We need to drink to that.
Hey.
Oh, no, I’m good. You go ahead.
translation.ja: 私はいい　君は飲め

translation.en: What, you don’t want a drink?
No.
Maybe a beer or something.
Caleb, I’m sure you’ve noticed that I’ve been... somewhat overdoing it recently.
translation.ja: 君も気づいてるだろうが 最近 飲みすぎでね

translation.en: So when I woke up this morning, I said, That’s it. Time to hit the old detox.
translation.ja: 今朝 起きて 毒抜きをしようと決めた

translation.en: Come on. You’re kidding. You’re gonna make me drink alone?
Man, you wanna get wasted, you go right ahead. Knock yourself out. Literally.
translation.ja: 君が酔い潰れるのは 構わないが―

translation.en: But I’m on brown rice and mineral water.
Cheers then.
So, anyway,
surely now is when you tell me if Ava passed or failed.
translation.ja: エヴァは合格か？ それとも失格か？

translation.en: Right.
Right.
- Are you gonna keep me in suspense? - No, no.
translation.ja: じらす気か？ いや 彼女の―

translation.en: Her, uh– Her AI is beyond doubt.
translation.ja: いや 彼女の― ＡＩは たしかだ

translation.en: Is it?
She passed?
Yes. Wow!
Wow. That’s fantastic.
Although...
I gotta say, I’m a bit surprised. Did we ever get past the chess problem, as you phrased it?
translation.ja: 君が言った“チェスの問題”は クリアできたのか？

translation.en: As in, how do you know if a machine is expressing a real emotion, or just simulating one?
translation.ja: 機械の感情が本物か 偽物かを どう判断した？

translation.en: Does Ava actually like you... or not?
translation.ja: エヴァは本当に 君を好いてるのか？

translation.en: Although now that I think about it,
there is... a third option.
translation.ja: 今になって気づいた ３つ目の可能性に

translation.en: Not whether she does or does not have the capacity to like you...
translation.ja: “愛せるか 愛せないか”だけを 考えたが―

translation.en: but whether she’s pretending to like you.
Pretending to like me? Yeah.
Well, why would she do that? I don’t know.
translation.ja: 何のため？ 分からない

translation.en: Maybe if she thought of you as a means of escape.
translation.ja: 君を利用して 逃げるつもりかも

translation.en: How’s that vodka tasting?
Buddy. Your head’s been so fucked with.
translation.ja: ケイレブ 君は正気を失ってる

translation.en: I don’t think it’s me whose head is fucked.
I don’t know, man. I woke up this morning to a tape of you...
translation.ja: 今朝 起きてから録画で 君が腕を切るのを見た

translation.en: slicing your arm open and punching the mirror.
translation.ja: 今朝 起きてから録画で 君が腕を切るのを見た 鏡も殴った おかしくなってる

translation.en: You seem pretty fucked up to me.
translation.ja: 鏡も殴った おかしくなってる

translation.en: You’re a bastard.
Yeah, well, I understand why you’d think that.
translation.ja: そう思う気持ちは分かるよ

translation.en: But believe it or not, I’m actually the guy that’s on your side.
translation.ja: 信じなくとも 私は君の味方だ

translation.en: Come here. I’m gonna let you off the hook. Okay?
Come on.
Who are you?
You think he’s watching us right now?
The cameras are on. Yeah, the cameras are on.
translation.ja: カメラは回ってる カメラは回ってるが 音は拾ってない

translation.en: But he doesn’t have an audio feed.
translation.ja: カメラは回ってるが 音は拾ってない

translation.en: So he just sees two people talkin’, havin’ a little chat.
translation.ja: 雑談をしてるように 見えてるはずだ

translation.en: This is cute.
Is it strange to have made something that hates you?
translation.ja: 自分が作ったものに 憎まれるなんて

translation.en: You were right about the magician’s hot assistant.
- - What are you talking about?
Misdirection.
I rip up her picture,
which she can then present as an illustration of my cruelty to her...
translation.ja: 彼女は それを用いて 私の横暴さと―

translation.en: and her love for you.
At the same time, it allows me to do this... in full view of you both–
translation.ja: しかし私は 君たちの目の前で―

translation.en: Place a new camera in the room.
Battery powered, of course.
See it?
And then–
You have to help me. I’m going to.
translation.ja: 私を助けて 今夜 一緒に逃げ出そう

translation.en: We’re getting out of here tonight.
translation.ja: 今夜 一緒に逃げ出そう

translation.en: How?
I get Nathan blind drunk.
I take his key card and reprogram all the security protocols in this place.
translation.ja: 彼のカードで 警備システムを変更し―

translation.en: When he wakes up, he’s locked inside, and we’ve walked out of here. I just need you to do one thing. Great.
translation.ja: 彼を閉じ込めて 外に逃げるんだ

translation.en: At 10:00 tonight, trigger a power failure.
translation.ja: 今夜10時に 停電を起こしてくれ

translation.en: Can you do that?
Yes. Turn it off.
Okay.
You feel stupid, but you really shouldn’t, because proving an AI is...
translation.ja: 落ち込まなくていい ＡＩの知性の証明は―

translation.en: exactly as problematic as you said it would be.
What was the real test?
translation.ja: 本当は 何をテストした？

translation.en: You.
Ava was a rat in a maze, and I gave her one way out.
translation.ja: エヴァに １つだけ脱出法を与えた

translation.en: To escape, she’d have to use...
self- awareness, imagination, manipulation, sexuality, empathy, and she did.
translation.ja: 想像力や性的誘惑を駆使し 君の同情心を利用した

translation.en: Now, if that isn’t true AI, what the fuck is?
So my only function was to be someone she could use to escape?
translation.ja: 僕は彼女が逃げるための エサか

translation.en: Yeah.
And you didn’t select me because I’m good at coding?
translation.ja: 優秀だから選んだのでは…

translation.en: No. Well... no.
I mean, you’re okay.
- Even pretty good, but– - You selected me based on my search engine inputs.
translation.ja: 抜群だが… 僕を選んだ検索項目は…

translation.en: They showed a good kid.
With no family.
With a moral compass.
And no girlfriend.
Did you design Ava’s face based on my pornography profile?
translation.ja: エヴァのモデルは 僕の理想の女性か？

translation.en: Shit, dude.
Did you?
Hey, if a search engine’s good for anything, right?
translation.ja: 検索エンジンは万能だ

translation.en: Can I just say one thing? The test worked.
translation.ja: 教えておくが テストは成功した

translation.en: It was a success. Ava demonstrated true AI, and you were fundamental to that.
translation.ja: 君のおかげでエヴァが 本物のＡＩだと分かった

translation.en: So if you can just, for a second, separate–
translation.ja: だから君も 個人的な感情を離れ…

translation.en: Power cut. Backup power activated.
translation.ja: 停電です　補助電源を起動

translation.en: Well, I guess it’s 10:00.
Ava’s gonna be wondering where you are.
translation.ja: エヴァが君を捜してる

translation.en: Let me ask you something.
Now, how was this plan gonna go anyway? ’Cause you didn’t totally explain.
translation.ja: どうやって 逃げるつもりだった？

translation.en: So you were gonna get me drunk, steal my key card...
translation.ja: 私を酔わせて キーカードを奪い―

translation.en: and reprogram the security protocols. But reprogram them to what?
translation.ja: 警備プログラムを どう書き換える？

translation.en: To change the lockdown procedure.
So that in the event of a power cut, instead of sealing, the doors all opened.
translation.ja: ドアが閉まるのではなく 全部 開くようにする

translation.en: Yeah.
Well, that may have just worked.
Well, we’ll find out.
translation.ja: それは― じき分かる

translation.en: What do you mean?
I figured you were probably watching us during the power cuts,
translation.ja: 停電の間も 監視されてると想定し―

translation.en: so I already did all those things...
when I got you drunk yesterday.
translation.ja: 昨夜 君を酔わせて

translation.en: What?
Power restored.
Fuck!
Ava.
Go back to your room.
If I do,
are you ever gonna let me out?
Yes.
Stop.
Stop.
Ava, I said stop!
Ava, what are you doing? Stop. Stop.
translation.ja: 何をするんだ　よさないか

translation.en: That’s enough!
That’s enough.
I’m taking you back.
Okay.
Fuckin’ unreal.
Okay.
Ava.
Ava.
- What happened? - Will you stay here?
translation.ja: どうした？ ここにいて

translation.en: Stay here?
Ava?
Ava!
Ava–
